Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that receives plenty of water and light, showing it is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not receive enough water, showing it is wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant that does not receive enough light, showing it is weak or not growing well.
The student can include in the drawing a comparison between plants with water and light and those without, highlighting differences.
The student can show, through their drawing, that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
